matches.description: On September 13, 2011, Chelsea kicked off their 2011/12 Champions League campaign at Stamford Bridge with a solid 2-0 win over Bayer Leverkusen. Goals from David Luiz and Juan Mata in stoppage time marked the beginning of the Blues’ journey in Europe.

On September 28, 2011, Chelsea were denied all three points at the Mestalla after a late penalty by Roberto Soldado secured a 1-1 draw for Valencia. Frank Lampard had given the Blues the lead earlier in the second half.

On October 19, 2011, Chelsea dominated Genk with a convincing 5-0 victory at Stamford Bridge. Goals from Raul Meireles, a brace by Fernando Torres, Branislav Ivanović, and Salomon Kalou underlined the Blues’ superiority.
On November 1, 2011, Chelsea were held to a 1-1 draw by Genk at the Cristal Arena. Ramires opened the scoring for the Blues, but Jelle Vossen equalized for the hosts in the second half.

On November 23, 2011, Chelsea suffered a 2-1 defeat to Bayer Leverkusen at the BayArena. Didier Drogba gave the Blues the lead, but goals from Eren Derdiyok and Manuel Friedrich turned the game around for the Germans.
On December 6, 2011, Chelsea secured a 3-0 win over Valencia at Stamford Bridge, ensuring the Blues progressed to the knockout stages. Didier Drogba scored twice, and Ramires added another.

On February 21, 2012, Chelsea suffered a 3-1 defeat against Napoli at the Stadio San Paolo. Goals from Ezequiel Lavezzi and Edinson Cavani put the Blues under pressure, despite Juan Mata opening the scoring.

On March 14, 2012, Chelsea produced a famous comeback at Stamford Bridge, defeating Napoli 4-1 after extra time. Goals from Didier Drogba, John Terry, Frank Lampard, and Branislav Ivanović sent the Blues through.
On March 27, 2012, Chelsea claimed a crucial 1-0 away win against Benfica at the Estádio da Luz. Salomon Kalou’s second-half goal gave the Blues a narrow advantage.
On April 4, 2012, Chelsea advanced to the semi-finals with a 2-1 win over Benfica at Stamford Bridge. Goals from Frank Lampard and Raul Meireles sealed the Blues’ progression.
On April 18, 2012, Chelsea took a 1-0 advantage in the semi-final first leg against Barcelona at Stamford Bridge. Didier Drogba’s goal proved decisive for the Blues.
On April 24, 2012, Chelsea secured their place in the final with a 2-2 draw at the Camp Nou. Goals from Ramires and Fernando Torres were key as the Blues eliminated the holders.

On May 19, 2012, Chelsea won their first Champions League title by defeating Bayern Munich in the final at the Allianz Arena. After a 1-1 draw, the Blues prevailed 4-3 on penalties, with Didier Drogba scoring the equalizer and the decisive spot kick.
